report.title: A Minor Trial
report.author: Rudolph
report.bodytext: My father is dying, and he is caught in a weird twilight zone where the past keeps jumping out at him. /n /n He was prescribed Zyprexa 2.5mg a day (he is very frail) as well as an anti Alzheimer's drug, which my mother discontinued. /n /n I've become very close to my father in the last year. As he realized he was dying a depression set in, and he started to spill the beans and confess to transgressions hard to understand. Pandora's box was open, at least in his head. /n /n I tried a 2.5mg Zyprexa pill on a rather lazy day. My wife and I walked around the streets of Toronto's East side. The only effect I felt from the pill was a mild 'grooviness' - much like a low dose benzodiazipine, a beer, or a toke. I felt a little bit anxious and confused, but that could be compounded by my emotional state. As well I drank coffee, which I hadn't touched in a week, so my fluttery heart may have been due more to that than anything. /n /n Apparently this is an extremely low dose and it is supposed to take a few days to take full effect, so....... /n /n Compared to many psych meds, it was quite pleasant, though not anything I would be looking for.
